subject: Re: [junit] hai
msgSnippet: ... And of course there is Test Driven Development by Example  - Kent Beck Test Driven Development: A Practical Guide - David Astels These 2 and the Unit
messageBody:
Chip Dunning wrote:

>Listed in no particular order:
>
>1) "JUnit in Action" (Author Vincent Massol)
>2) "Unit Testing in Java - How Tests Drive the Code" (Author Johannes Link)
>
>Finally, if you don't mind waiting rumors point out that "JUnit Cookbook" (Author: J. B. Rainsberger) is supposed to be published sometime this decade.
>
>As an added bonus all of these authors can be found on this list - some are even pleasant to talk to.
>
>
>Chip
>-----
>Programming: Its not just a job - its an indenture
>
>
>
>
And of course there is

Test Driven Development by Example - Kent Beck
Test Driven Development: A Practical Guide - David Astels

These 2 and the Unit Testing in Java book have all been very helpful for me.
